subject: Re: sharing setup across tests => design problem
msgSnippet: The design problem is typically with the code under test. For example, if I have a bunch of code that uses one single global database accessed as a singleton,
messageBody:
The design problem is typically with the code under test. For
example, if I have a bunch of code that uses one single global
database accessed as a singleton, I may want to set up the database
once for all my tests. If I force myself to think carefully about the
visibility of the database, I find that I can restrict access to it
to a few objects. If I just use TestSetup, I miss the chance to think
carefully.

Kent

--- In junit@y..., noer2b@y... wrote:
> Kent: are you saying the design problem is typically with the
tests,
> the unit under test, or both?
>
> --- In junit@y..., kentbeck@c... wrote:
> > When I feel like sharing setup between tests, I usually have a

> > Kent
